decks.notes: This deck focuses on fast, aggressive play with a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a steady flow of spells and creatures, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off opponents. The deck also includes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Violent Urge to further enhance its aggressive capabilities and ensure a swift victory.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo to deal massive damage to the opponent without relying on traditional land sources. It includes disruptive counterspells and removal to protect the combo pieces, as well as card draw to find key cards. The strategy focuses on efficiently using mana sources like Lotus Bloom and Hydroelectric Specimen to cast spells and ultimately win the game through the Charbelcher's ability. Additionally, the deck features a variety of control elements to handle opposing threats and maintain board control.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. It aims to control the game by efficiently managing threats and keeping the opponent off balance. The deck also includes threats of its own in the form of Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, providing a win condition while maintaining control. With a mix of card draw, removal, and permission spells, this Dimir Control deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through strategic decision-making and resource management.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through efficient counterspells and removal spells while also generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tune the Narrative. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells and removing threats while also protecting the player's own permanents. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency in casting spells and accessing multiple colors. The deck's strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent by controlling the board and winning the game through incremental advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on aggressive plays and efficient removal to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls provide early pressure, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer powerful finishers. Arena of Glory helps protect creatures and boost their power, while Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through relentless aggression and efficient removal spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-to-deal-with threats while also having ways to deal with the opponent's creatures and disrupt their game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly bringing powerful creatures back from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation. By combining instant speed reanimation with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes ways to control the board with cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, allowing for a versatile and resilient game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude to control the opponent's board while also deploying creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones to apply early pressure. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Thoughtseize help disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to maintain a tempo advantage. The deck also includes powerful synergy cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to maximize value from enter-the-battlefield triggers, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize.

The key concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells while also generating card advantage. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, as well as removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies. The deck also utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Solitude and Subtlety to provide additional threats and answers to the opponent's threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly mill the opponent's deck, using cards like Archive Trap, Fractured Sanity, and Hedron Crab to increase the opponent's graveyard. This is combined with disruption cards like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to keep the opponent from mounting a counterattack. The deck also includes Tasha's Hideous Laughter to exile cards from the opponent's graveyard, further hindering their strategy. Overall, the goal is to mill the opponent out of cards as quickly as possible while controlling the game with removal and disruption spells.

The deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo, utilizing cards like Primeval Titan, Amulet of Vigor, and Scapeshift to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and land ramp. The deck includes a mix of utility lands, ramp spells, and tutor effects to ensure consistency in pulling off the combo. The goal is to quickly ramp up mana production, find key combo pieces, and create a dominating board state that can win the game in a single turn.

Utilize artifacts and fast mana sources to quickly overwhelm opponents with a low-to-the-ground creature base, utilizing evasion and disruptive elements to push through damage efficiently and effectively. The deck aims to generate early advantage through explosive starts and maintain pressure throughout the game, leveraging synergy between artifacts and creatures to create a relentless aggressive strategy that can quickly close out games before opponents have a chance to stabilize. By combining efficient threats with disruptive elements, the deck aims to present a fast clock while disrupting opponents' game plans, aiming to secure victories through a combination of tempo and aggression.

This deck focuses on generating mana with Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It uses cards like Springleaf Drum and Blade of the Bloodchief to create combat advantage with Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also includes disruption with removal spells like Devour Flesh and Thoughtseize, as well as various utility cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Malevolent Rumble. The goal is to assemble powerful combinations of cards to overwhelm the opponent and win through a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying early pressure with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. It also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude to control the board. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources with Thoughtseize and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker while leveraging cards like Overlord of the Balemurk and Witch Enchanter for additional value. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its aggressive and disruptive game plan.

This deck focuses on generating explosive early-game aggression by utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm opponents. By taking advantage of cards that can be played for free or at a reduced cost, the deck aims to flood the board with threats and utilize cards like Cranial Plating to enhance their power. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt to help control the pace of the game. The goal is to win quickly through a combination of creature beatdown and efficient use of resources.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to stall the game and disrupt your opponent's game plan through various counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage tools. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler for tempo advantage, Stock Up for card draw, and Ephemerate for recursion, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a well-balanced mix of interaction and card advantage, the deck seeks to grind out incremental advantages and ultimately dominate the late game with powerful finishers like Wrath of the Skies and Solitude.
